raw_comment:
We noticed that younger groups are more optimistic and the older group is less optimistic. We noticed that there is a diagonal line separating adolescents and adults. We know this because there are more dots on the younger side. We wonder why the country selection is seemingly random. Does the country's wealth affect optimism? How accurate is the data perceived in the graph? If the data is accurate that means it's good that the younger people are more optimistic because they are the leading generation. What determines how far a dot is on the x-axis? We wonder why there is such a difference and what the leading opinions for the 15-24 year-olds are vs the 40+ year-olds. What makes other countries less optimistic than others? How does the younger generation's impact and involvement in society affect how they and others view the world? If we were to rename this graph we would name it "The Optimism of the Younger Generation." 

 Max, Grace, Mac, and Cierra - "Wordle Gods"
ace_sentences: We noticed that younger groups are more optimistic.
We noticed that older groups are less optimistic.
We noticed that a diagonal line separates adolescents and adults.
We know this because there are more dots on the younger side.
We wonder why the selection of countries seems random.
We ask whether the wealth of a country affects optimism.
We ask how accurate the data in the graph is.
If the data is accurate then it is good that younger people are more optimistic.
Younger people are the leading generation.
We ask what determines the position of a dot on the x-axis.
We wonder why there is such a difference between age groups.
We ask what the leading opinions of 15-24 year-olds are.
We ask what the leading opinions of people who are 40 years old or older are.
We ask what makes some countries less optimistic than other countries.
We ask how the impact of the younger generation on society affects how the younger generation views the world.
We ask how the involvement of the younger generation in society affects how other people view the world.
If we rename this graph then we name it "The Optimism of the Younger Generation".
Max is a person.
Grace is a person.
Mac is a person.
Cierra is a person.
Max is a Wordle God.
Grace is a Wordle God.
Mac is a Wordle God.
Cierra is a Wordle God.
